alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 10:14AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and northern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey...Mercer. In northern New Jersey...Middlesex and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some shallow water may be found over roadways in poor-draining areas. Slow down and use caution driving. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1012 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall up to 0.5 inches is possible in the next hour or two. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Trenton, New Brunswick, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, North Brunswick, Ewing, Carteret, Middlesex, Princeton, and Pennington. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 12. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 65 and 76. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 11. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 130 and 133. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
